title: Michael Ignatieff
description: Born in Canada and educated at the University of Toronto and Harvard, Michael Ignatieff is a university professor, writer and former politician. He is currently the Rector and President of Central European University in Budapest.

title: David Runciman
description: David Runciman is Professor of Politics in the Department of Politics and International Studies at the University of Cambridge. He is an expert on 19th and 20th Century political thought and his latest book is “How Democracy Ends”.

title: Carol Anderson
description: Carol Anderson is Charles Howard Candler Professor of African American Studies at Emory University. Professor Anderson’s research and teaching focus on public policy; particularly the ways that domestic and international policies intersect through the issues of race, justice and equality in the United States.

title: Adrian Wooldridge
description: Adrian Wooldridge is the political editor and Bagehot columnist at The Economist, which released a manifesto to reinvent liberalism in September 2018.

title: Soraya Chemaly
description: Soraya Chemaly is an award-winning writer and media critic and the director of the Women’s Media Center Speech Project.

title: Norman Eisen
description: Ambassador Norman Eisen is a senior fellow in Governance Studies at the Brookings Institution and the former Ambassador of the United States to the Czech Republic.

title: Ivan Krastev
description: Ivan Krastev is chairman of the Centre for Liberal Strategies in Sofia and permanent fellow at the Institute for Human Sciences in Vienna.

title: Earl Lewis
description: Earl Lewis is the founding director of the Center for Social Solutions and Professor of History at the University of Michigan.

title: Washington Symposium
description: At our Washington Symposium in April, 2019, we asked leaders from business, politics, and culture to respond to the question: “How do we fix democracy?” These are their answers.

title: Madeleine Albright
description: Madeleine Albright is Chair of Albright Stonebridge Group and was the 64th Secretary of State of the United States.
